snippet: If the Islamic State’s role in a suicide bombing that killed 35 civilians on Saturday is confirmed, the attack would be a major escalation of the group’s activities in Afghanistan.
abstract: Afghan Pres Ashraf Ghani attributes deadly suicide bombing in Jalalabad to the Islamic State; incident claims lives of 35 civilians, and could suggest major escalation of ISIS operations in region if responsibility is confirmed.

byline.original: By KHALID ALOKOZAY and ROD NORDLAND
byline.contributor: Khalid Alokozay reported from Jalalabad, and Rod Nordland from Kabul, Afghanistan. Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul, and Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: If the Islamic State’s role in a suicide bombing that killed 35 civilians on Saturday is confirmed, the attack would be a major escalation of the group’s activities in Afghanistan.

headline.main: Afghan President Blames ISIS for a Bombing
headline.print_headline: Afghan President Blames ISIS for a Bombing

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
